pageContext.claim: “LaVar, you could have spent the next 5 to 10 years during Thanksgiving with your son in China, but no NBA contract to support you. But remember LaVar, shoplifting is NOT a little thing. It's a really big deal, especially in China. Ungrateful fool!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, in tweeting at LaVar Ball, greatly overstates the possible jail time faced by LiAngelo Ball and two other UCLA basketball players for shoplifting sunglasses in China. The Washington Post reported: "The sunglasses in the Louis Vuitton store in Hangzhou are priced at or around 4,900 yuan ($750). According to Chinese law, anyone stealing goods worth between 4,000 and 7,000 yuan faces between one and two years in jail, although the sentence can be mitigated if they confess, show remorse and pay compensation." Generally, foreigners do not endure jail time in China for such an offense.
